intro: Brachyphragma serenoi, commonly known as the Serenoi bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassland habitats and thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
